intro: Pentacalia inornata, commonly known as the white pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
